column4: hello, i'm trying to install ubuntu-alternative-11.04 on a netbook, from a USB external hard drive (not a USB stick), but I don't find a tool to make my usb external hard drive bootable.
there's not usb-creator.exe in the .iso
and unetbootin does not recognize my usb external hard drive
I remember once having the option to "install from a .iso on another partition" but I could never find it again. It might have been in an alternate CD, a server CD, or a mini.iso
alternatively, if you have another machine, you could install LAMP on there, and then do a 'network install' (I can find the howto if you want). You might need a CD (or USB) to boot the mini.iso
i managed to install several other linux os like debian or even ubuntu-desktop but i can't find a way for the ubuntu-alternate version
I see. Do you have a windows machine that you can use? Do you have another USB flash drive that you can use?
is the ubuntu-alternate.iso the only thing on your external HDD?
